title: How to Get Luigi on New Super Mario Bros. DS

steps.title: Start the game like normal.
steps.content: Start the game like normal. Some rumors on the internet claim you need to beat the game before you get Luigi, but this is only true for the sequel, not the original. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to the file selection screen but don't pick a game just yet.
steps.content: Navigate to the file selection screen but don't pick a game just yet. This is the screen with you three potential save files, allowing you to have three games at once. Do not pick your game just yet.

steps.title: Highlight your desired file.
steps.content: Highlight your desired file. This will work with any file. Make sure the game you want to play has the selection box around it.

steps.title: Hold the L and R buttons, located on the upper shoulders of the DS.
steps.content: Hold the L and R buttons, located on the upper shoulders of the DS. Keep both of them held down simultaneously.

steps.title: Still holding L and R, hit the A button to start your game.
steps.content: Still holding L and R, hit the A button to start your game. This should unlock the plucky, lanky Luigi to play. You can repeat this procedure anytime you'd rather play with him instead of Mario.

steps.title: Let go of L, and R and start playing.
steps.content: Let go of L, and R and start playing. You should hear Luigi shout out "Luigi!" if you have done it correctly. If not, turn the DS off and try again. Keep L and R held down the entire time, only letting go after you hear the green bomber's signature voice. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Play the game exactly like normal, as Luigi hasn't changed in playstyle.
steps.content: Play the game exactly like normal, as Luigi hasn't changed in playstyle. Shifting to Luigi is purely cosmetic -- he doesn't have any different stats or playing characteristics. He will have different sound effects and animations, however! [3] X Research source Some people believe Luigi has a higher jump, but slips and slides more than Mario. However, there is no evidence of this change from the manufacturers. This is likely because he is more powerful in the game "New Super Luigi U." [4] X Research source

steps.title: Beat the entire game on any difficulty.
steps.content: Beat the entire game on any difficulty. Once you toss off the Koopa King Bowser at the end of World Six, make sure you hit save.

steps.title: After saving, turn the game off and restart it.
steps.content: After saving, turn the game off and restart it. Make sure, of course, that you actually save the game, otherwise you'll have to defeat Bowser all over again!

steps.title: Open the game and navigate to the file select screen.
steps.content: Open the game and navigate to the file select screen. This is simply the screen where you pick which game file you want to play on. Don't click one just yet.

steps.title: Hold the two shoulder buttons, L and R, simultaneously.
steps.content: Hold the two shoulder buttons, L and R, simultaneously. Don't let go until you finish the next step.

steps.title: Still holding L and R, click on the game file that you want to play as Luigi.
steps.content: Still holding L and R, click on the game file that you want to play as Luigi. You should hear the green-clad plumber shout out a simple "Let's a-Go!" or other quick noise to indicate that you selected him.

steps.title: Play as Luigi, knowing that he handles exactly the same as Mario.
steps.content: Play as Luigi, knowing that he handles exactly the same as Mario. From here, you can go back through any of the stages as the less-known younger brother of the family. The controls and timing are all identical to the older plumber in red. [5] X Research source
